snippet: Authoritarian governments are passing laws to drive out independent groups that are critical to fostering civil society.
abstract: Editorial calls Chinese law putting strict controls on foreign nongovernmental organizations deplorable, noting that it is clearly intended to intimidate these organizations or shut them down; notes Chinese Pres Xi Jinping, like number of other leaders of developing and post-Communist countries, is wary of services that strengthen civil society.
lead_paragraph: Authoritarian governments are passing laws to drive out independent groups that are critical to fostering civil society.
